comments.author: Rob
comments.body: Alas, I'm going to the graduation ceremony at the theatre department. I'll be riding up poorman instead, at about 10:30, if anyone cares to join me!

comments.author: Jennifer
comments.body: Watch out for eager bright graduates and the increased population of family/friends' out-of-towner driving and parking practices! It's just a safety tip from yours truly. I'm not reflecting on my graduation experience and subsequent existential crisis last spring at all. "Time heals all wounds," and so on and so forth. Have a lovely weekend, all. JG

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Well said, J. We'd noticed the existential thing, didn't want to bring it up, knowing how painful it can be. I had mine surgically removed back in the eighties. They do it arthroscopically now - much smaller incision. Thankfully they don't replace it w/ anything; they just yank it the hell out.
